event: Slavic communities consolidate in the mountainous interior
Bosnian state emerges independent of neighboring powers
Ottoman conquest introduces Islam and new urban centers
Multi-religious society forms under Ottoman administration
Bosnia becomes a frontier province against Habsburg lands
Austro-Hungarian rule modernizes administration and cities
Sarajevo assassination triggers World War I
Bosnia absorbed into a South Slavic state
World War II brings occupation and civil violence
Independence leads to war and territorial fragmentation
